name: Scenario A: Routine Refurbishment
description: Class IIa patient monitor with electrical fault (routine risk category) â€” skips regulatory review, 4 actions to refurbishment certificate

1.failureDescription: Intermittent power supply failure causing unexpected shutdowns during monitoring. PSU capacitors showing degradation on bench test. Internal 12V rail dropping below 10.8V under load.

2.approvalNotes: Approved. ICU requires this monitor back in service urgently. Budget allocated from Q1 medical equipment maintenance fund. Estimated cost within acceptable range for Class IIa device repair.

3.initialAssessment: Power supply unit failure confirmed. Three electrolytic capacitors in the 12V regulation circuit show visible bulging and ESR readings exceed tolerance. Main board and display assembly tested OK. Standard PSU refurbishment procedure applies.
3.partsRequired: 3x electrolytic capacitors (470uF 25V), 1x voltage regulator IC (LM7812), 1x PSU PCB connector set, thermal paste

5.workPerformed: Replaced three failed electrolytic capacitors and voltage regulator IC on PSU board. Resoldered dry joints on main connector. Applied fresh thermal compound to heat sink. Full electrical safety test (IEC 62353) passed. 48-hour burn-in test completed with no shutdowns.
5.partsReplaced: 3x electrolytic capacitors (470uF 25V, Panasonic EEU-FC1E471), 1x voltage regulator (LM7812CT), 1x connector set (Philips P/N 453564020901)
5.testResults: IEC 62353 electrical safety: PASS. Earth leakage: 0.12mA (limit 0.5mA). Insulation resistance: >200MOhm. 12V rail stability: 11.98-12.02V under full load. 48-hour continuous operation: zero shutdowns, all parameters nominal.
